algorithms.figure: H~X Division of Birds
AN INDEX GUIDE TO THE Avicultural Magazine k FROM The commencement, November, 1894, to December, 1930 Compiled by E. H.
algorithms.bodyText: The Avicultural Society was founded in November, 1894, when the first number of the Avicultural Magazine was published, thus, to the end of 1980, thirty-six volumes have been produced and an index to the whole series was very desirable if not essential to the more serious avicultural students. But it was found that to produce a complete index for the whole series on the lines of those published with each annual volume would involve an expense which the Society could not contemplate. The idea having been abandoned, Dr. E. Hopkinson most generously came forward and offered to compile a Selective Index or Index-guide to the past volumes and the Council gratefully accepted his kind offer. It must be understood that this does not profess to be a complete index to every bird mentioned in the past volumes, but it is a working index by which every reference of importance can readily be traced. The mechod of using it is clearly explained by its compiler on page 3. The earlier volumes commenced each year in November, thus overlapping two calendar years, but where reference is made to a year, such for instance as 1905, it refers to the volume commencing in November, 1904, and ending October, 1905. It is recommended that for convenience of reference members should mark on the back of each volume, prior to 1925, its year, such as is done on the official binding from 1925 onwards. D. S-S.
algorithms.sectionHeader: AN INDEX-GUIDE TO THE AVICULTURAL MAGAZINE
algorithms.bodyText: The following is an attempt to provide a working index to the mass of interesting information which is contained in the thirty-six volumes of the Magazine since its commencement in November, 1894, to the end of 1930. It is divided into three parts :--
algorithms.listItem: (i) Alphabetical Index. In this, references such as " ii. 22 ", etc., mean "Part ii, Section (NOT page) 22 ", the others indicate the year and page of the various volumes of the Magazine. (ii) Classified List of Birds, commencing with the Passeres and concluding with the Ratitae. (iii) List of Contributors with dates of their earliest and latest
algorithms.bodyText: contributions. The chief abbreviations used are :--
